definition:
A *coloring* of a set $X$ by $Y$ is just a function $f:X\rightarrow Y$.
The term coloring is used because the function can be thought of as
assigning a “color” from $Y$ to each element of $X$.

Any coloring provides a partition of $X$: for each $y\in Y$,
$f^{-1}(y)$, the set of elements $x$ such that $f(x)=y$, is one element
of the partition. Since $f$ is a function, the sets in the partition are
disjoint, and since it is a total function, their union is $X$.
